license.name: Norwegian Licence for Open Government Data (NLOD) 2.0

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The sources to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on source.

parameters.name: sourcenames
parameters.description: The source names to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on source name.

parameters.name: counties
parameters.description: The counties to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on county.

parameters.name: municipalities
parameters.description: The municipalities to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on municipality.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: The elements to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on element.

parameters.name: months
parameters.description: The months to get records for as a comma-separated list of integers or integer ranges between 1 and 12, e.g. '1,5,8-12'.  If left out, the output is not filtered on month.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The information to return as a comma-separated list of 'sourceid', 'sourcename', 'county', 'municipality', 'elementid', 'month', 'referencetime', or 'value'. For example 'county,month,referencetime1,elementid,value'. If omitted, all fields are returned.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for this combination of query parameters.

get.summary: Get lightning data form the Frost API.
get.description: Get lightning data from the MET Norway's data storage systems. The query parameters act as a filter; if all were left blank (not allowed in practice), one would retrieve all of the lightning data in the system. Restrict the data using the query parameters.

parameters.name: referencetime
parameters.description: The time range to get observations for in either extended ISO-8601 format or the single word 'latest'. See Time Specifications for documentation and examples.

parameters.name: maxage
parameters.description: The maximum observation age as an ISO-8601 period, like 'P1D'. Applicable only when referencetime=latest. In general, the lower the value of maxage, the shorter the request will take to complete. The default value is 'PT5M'.

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: Get lightning within a polygon specified as POLYGON(...) using WKT; see the reference section on the Geometry Specification for documentation and examples.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result is ualf

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.description: Get climate normals. To be expanded.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The sources to get climate normals for as a comma-separated list. Each source should be of the form SN<number>.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: The elements to get climate normals for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The validity period, e.g. '1931/1960'. If specified, only climate normals for this period will be returned.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for this combination of query parameters.

get.summary: Get available combinations of sources, elements, and periods for climate normals.
get.description: Get available combinations of sources, elements, and periods for climate normals. To be expanded.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: If specified, only combinations matching these sources may be included in the output. Enter a comma-separated list of sources of the form SN<number>. If omitted, any source will match.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: If specified, only combinations matching these elements may be included in the output. Enter a comma-separated list of element names in the form of search filters. If omitted, any element will match.

parameters.name: periods
parameters.description: If specified, only combinations matching these validity periods may be included in the output. Enter a comma-separated list of validity period of the form '<from year>/<to year>', e.g. '1931/1960'.  If omitted, any period will match.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Specifies what information to return as a comma-separated list of 'sourceid', 'elementid', or 'period'. For example, 'sourceid,period' specifies that only source IDs and periods will appear in the output. If omitted, all fields are returned.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for this combination of query parameters.

get.summary: Get metada for Frost API locations.
get.description: Get metadata for the location names defined in the Frost API. Use the query parameters to filter the set of location names returned. Leave the query parameters blank to select **all** location names.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The Frost API location names that you want metadata for. Enter a comma-separated list to select multiple location names. Leave blank to get all names.

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: Get Frost API location names by geometry. Geometries are specified as either nearest(POINT(...)) or POLYGON(...) using WKT; see the reference section on the Geometry Specification for documentation and examples.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the fields that should be present in the response. If set, only those properties listed here will be visible in the result set; e.g.: name,geometry will show only those two entries in the data set.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.description:
This endpoint has been deprecated due to technical limitations.
    A response that used to return data with status 200 Ok will now instead return a descriptive
    error message with status 404 Not Found.

    Updated IDF data can for now be retrieved in Frost v1:

      Per station metadata (report type = idf):
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/reports/reportsAvailableGet

      Per station intensity values (report type = idf):
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/reports/reportsGet

      Gridded metadata:
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/idf/idfAvailableGet

      Gridded intensity values:
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/idf/idfGet

    NOTE: Frost v1 is currently under development and the request/response formats for IDF-data may be changed at some point.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The Frost API source ID(s) that you want IDF data for. Enter either a comma-separated list of one or more stations (each of the form SN<number>[:<number>|all]), or the name of a gridded dataset. If left out, IDF data for all available station sources is returned.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The geographic position from which to get IDF data in case of a gridded dataset. Format: POINT(<longitude degrees> <latitude degrees&gt). Data from the nearest grid point is returned.

parameters.name: durations
parameters.description: The Frost API IDF duration(s), in minutes, that you want IDF data for. Enter a comma-separated list to select multiple durations.

parameters.name: frequencies
parameters.description: The Frost API IDF frequencies (return periods), in years, that you want IDF data for. Enter a comma-separated list to select multiple frequencies.

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit of measure for the intensity. Specify 'mm' for millimetres per minute multiplied by the duration, or 'lsha' for litres per second per hectar. The default unit is 'lsha'

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the fields that should be present in the response. The sourceId and values attributes will always be returned in the query result. Leaving this parameter empty returns all attributes; otherwise only those properties listed will be visible in the result set (in addition to the sourceId and values); e.g.: unit,numberOfSeasons will show only sourceId, unit, numberOfSeasons, and values in the response.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get available sources for rainfall IDF data.
get.description:
This endpoint has been deprecated due to technical limitations.
    A response that used to return data with status 200 Ok will now instead return a descriptive
    error message with status 404 Not Found.

    Updated IDF data can for now be retrieved in Frost v1:

      Per station metadata (report type = idf):
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/reports/reportsAvailableGet

      Per station intensity values (report type = idf):
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/reports/reportsGet

      Gridded metadata:
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/idf/idfAvailableGet

      Gridded intensity values:
        https://frost-beta.met.no/docs/apirefadvanced#/idf/idfGet

    NOTE: Frost v1 is currently under development and the request/response formats for IDF-data may be changed at some point.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The Frost API source ID(s) that you want information for. Enter either a comma-separated list of one or more stations (each of the form SN<number>[:<number>|all]), or the name of a gridded dataset. If left out, information for all available sources is returned.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The type(s) of Frost API source that you want information for. Enter a comma-separated list to select multiple types.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the fields that should be present in the response. The sourceId attribute will always be returned in the query result. Leaving this parameter empty returns all attributes; otherwise only those properties listed will be visible in the result set (in addition to the sourceId); e.g.: validFrom,numberOfSeasons will show only sourceId, validFrom, and numberOfSeasons in the response.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get metadata about Frost API elements.
get.description: Get metadata about the weather and climate elements that are defined for use in the Frost API. Use the query parameters to filter which elements to return and what fields to include for each element. Leave the query parameters blank to select **all** elements. **Note:** an empty list of sensor level values in the output means that the sensor level values may vary dynamically for this element. In this case it will not be possible to filter on specific sensor level values in the sensorLevels query parameter.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The element IDs to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters. An element ID is structured as a calculation method.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The element names to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: descriptions
parameters.description: The descriptions to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: The units to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters. Note: when the unit is 'code', a codetable is in use.

parameters.name: codeTables
parameters.description: The code tables to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters. Note: When a codetable is in use, the unit is 'code'.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: The statuses to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: calculationMethod
parameters.description: The calculation method filter as a JSON filter that supports the following keys: baseNames, methods, innerMethods, periods, innerPeriods, thresholds, methodDescriptions, innerMethodDescriptions, methodUnits, and innerMethodUnits

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: The categories to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: timeOffsets
parameters.description: The time offsets to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: sensorLevels
parameters.description: The sensor levels filter as a JSON filter that supports the following keys: levelTypes, units, defaultValues, and values. **Note:** if the sensor level values may vary dynamically for the element, the values key won't have any effect.

parameters.name: oldElementCodes
parameters.description: The old MET Norway element codes to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: oldUnits
parameters.description: The old MET Norway units to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: cfStandardNames
parameters.description: The CF standard names to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: cfCellMethods
parameters.description: The CF cell methods to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: cfUnits
parameters.description: The CF units to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: cfVersions
parameters.description: The CF versions to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The information to return as a comma-separated list of id, name, description, unit, codeTable, status, cmBaseName, cmMethod, cmInnerMethod, cmPeriod, cmInnerPeriod, cmThreshold, cmMethodDescription, cmInnerMethodDescription, cmMethodUnit, cmInnerMethodUnit, category, sensorLevelType, sensorLevelUnit, sensorLevelDefaultValue, sensorLevelValues, oldElementCodes, oldUnit, cfStandardName, cfCellMethod, cfUnit, or cfVersion. For example 'id,unit,oldElementCodes,oldUnit'. If omitted, all fields are returned.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: ISO language/locale to be used for search filters and return values.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get metadata about Frost API code tables.
get.description: Get metadata about the code tables available in the Frost API. A code table defines a small number of discrete values for an element. Use the query parameters to filter which code tables to return and what fields to include for each one. Leave the query parameters blank to select **all** code tables.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The code table IDs to get metadata for as a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: The fields to include in the output in addition to the code table name as a comma-separated list of header and values. Leave the parameter empty to include both header and values.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: ISO language/locale to be used for search filters and return values.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get metada for Frost API sources.
get.description: Get metadata for the source entitites defined in the Frost API. Use the query parameters to filter the set of sources returned. Leave the query parameters blank to select **all** sources.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The Frost API source ID(s) that you want metadata for. Enter a comma-separated list to select multiple sources. For sources of type SensorSystem or RegionDataset, the source ID must be of the form <prefix><int> where <prefix> is SN for SensorSystem and TR, NR, GR, or GF for RegionDataset. The integer following the prefix may contain wildcards, e.g. SN18\*7\* matches both SN18700 and SN18007.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The type of Frost API source that you want metadata for.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: If specified, only sources for which observations are available for all of these elements may be included in the result. Enter a comma-separated list of search filters.

parameters.name: geometry
parameters.description: Get Frost API sources defined by a specified geometry. Geometries are specified as either nearest(POINT(...)) or POLYGON(...) using WKT; see the reference section on the Geometry Specification for documentation and examples. If the nearest() function is specified, the output will include the distance in kilometers from the reference point.

parameters.name: nearestmaxcount
parameters.description: The maximum number of sources returned when using nearest(POINT(...)) for geometry. The default value is 1.

parameters.name: validtime
parameters.description: If specified, only sources that have been, or still are, valid/applicable during some part of this interval may be included in the result. Specify <date>/<date>, <date>/now, <date>, or now, where <date> is of the form YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2017-03-06. The default is 'now', i.e. only currently valid/applicable sources are included.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'name' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'country' or 'countryCode' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: county
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'county' or 'countyId' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: municipality
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'municipality' or 'municipalityId' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: wmoid
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'wmoId' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: stationholder
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'stationHolders' attribute contains at least one name that matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: externalids
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'externalIds' attribute contains at least one value that matches any of the specified, comma-separated list of search filters may be included in the result.

parameters.name: icaocode
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'icaoCodes' attribute contains at least one name that matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: shipcode
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'shipCodes' attribute contains at least one name that matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: wigosid
parameters.description: If specified, only sources whose 'wigosId' attribute matches this search filter may be included in the result.

parameters.name: ontologyid
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the ontologyids that should be present in the response. Default if not set is to include all.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the fields that should be present in the response. If set, only those properties listed here will be visible in the result set; e.g.: name,country will show only those two entries in the result in addition to the id which is always shown.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Find timeseries metadata by source and/or element

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The ID(s) of the data sources to get time series for as a comma-separated list of Frost API station IDs: SN<int>[:<int>|all] (e.g. SN18700, SN18700:0, or SN18700:all). 0 is the main sensor and x≥1 is a parallel sensor. Retrieve the complete station lists using the sources resource. If left out, time series for all available stations are retrieved.

parameters.name: referencetime
parameters.description: The time range to get time series for as extended ISO-8601 format. See Time Specifications for documentation and examples. Note: in this case 'latest' is not supported, only the explicit from/to form. If left out, time series for all available periods are retrieved.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: The elements to get time series for as a comma-separated list of search filters. Elements follow the Frost API naming convention. Available element names can be found here. If left out, time series for all available elements are retrieved.

parameters.name: timeoffsets
parameters.description: The time offsets to get time series for as a comma-separated list of ISO-8601 periods, e.g. 'PT6H,PT18H' or default. If left out, the output is not filtered on time offset.

parameters.name: timeresolutions
parameters.description: The time resolutions to get time series for as a comma-separated list of ISO-8601 periods, e.g. 'PT6H,PT18H'. If left out, the output is not filtered on time resolution.

parameters.name: timeseriesids
parameters.description: The internal time series IDs to get time series for as a comma-separated list of integers, e.g. '0,1'. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: performancecategories
parameters.description: The performance categories to get time series for as a comma-separated list of letters, e.g. 'A,C'. If left out, the output is not filtered on performance category.

parameters.name: exposurecategories
parameters.description: The exposure categories to get time series for as a comma-separated list of integers, e.g. '1,2'. If left out, the output is not filtered on exposure category.

parameters.name: levels
parameters.description: The sensor levels to get observations for as a comma-separated list of numbers, e.g. '0.1,2,10,20' or default. If left out, the output is not filtered on sensor level.

parameters.name: levelTypes
parameters.description: The sensor level types to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on sensor level type.

parameters.name: levelUnits
parameters.description: The sensor level units to get records for as a comma-separated list of search filters. If left out, the output is not filtered on sensor level unit.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to include in the output as a comma-separated list. If specified, only these fields are included in the output. If left out, all fields are included.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get observation data from the Frost API.
get.description: This is the core resource for retrieving the actual observation data from MET Norway's data storage systems. The query parameters act as a filter; if all were left blank (not allowed in practice), one would retrieve all of the observation data in the system. Restrict the data using the query parameters. For possible input parameters see /sources, /elements, and /observations/timeseries.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: The ID(s) of the data sources to get observations for as a comma-separated list of Frost API station IDs: SN<int>[:<int>|all] (e.g. SN18700, SN18700:0, or SN18700:all). 0 is the main sensor and x≥1 is a parallel sensor. Retrieve the complete station lists using the sources resource.

parameters.name: referencetime
parameters.description: The time range to get observations for in either extended ISO-8601 format or the single word 'latest'. See Time Specifications for documentation and examples.

parameters.name: elements
parameters.description: The elements to get observations for as a comma-separated list of names that follow the Frost API naming convention. Available element names can be found here.

parameters.name: maxage
parameters.description: The maximum observation age as an ISO-8601 period, like 'P1D'. Applicable only when referencetime=latest. In general, the lower the value of maxage, the shorter the request will take to complete. The default value is 'PT3H'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of observation times to be returned for each source/element combination, counting from the most recent time. Applicable only when referencetime=latest. Specify either 'all' to get all available times, or a positive integer. The default value is 1.

parameters.name: timeoffsets
parameters.description: The time offsets to get observations for as a comma-separated list of ISO-8601 periods, e.g. 'PT6H,PT18H' or default. If left out, the output is not filtered on time offset.

parameters.name: timeresolutions
parameters.description: The time resolutions to get observations for as a comma-separated list of ISO-8601 periods, e.g. 'PT6H,PT18H'. If left out, the output is not filtered on time resolution.

parameters.name: timeseriesids
parameters.description: The internal time series IDs to get observations for as a comma-separated list of integers, e.g. '0,1'. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: performancecategories
parameters.description: The performance categories to get observations for as a comma-separated list of letters, e.g. 'A,C'. Enter a comma-separated list to specify multiple performance categories. If left out, the output is not filtered on performance category.

parameters.name: exposurecategories
parameters.description: The exposure categories to get observations for as a comma-separated list of integers, e.g. '1,2'. If left out, the output is not filtered on exposure category.

parameters.name: qualities
parameters.description: The qualities to get observations for as a comma-separated list of integers, e.g. '1,2'. See available qualities and their meaning. If left out, the output is not filtered by quality.

parameters.name: levels
parameters.description: The sensor levels to get observations for as a comma-separated list of numbers, e.g. '0.1,2,10,20' or default. If left out, the output is not filtered on sensor level.

parameters.name: includeextra
parameters.description: If this query parameter is set to 1 and extra data is available, this data is included in the response. Extra data currently consists of the original observation value and the 16-character control info.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to include in the output as a comma-separated list. If specified, only these fields are included in the output. If left out, all fields are included.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result. Json is fully supported, while CSV is still in Beta!

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the query parameters.

412.description: No available time series for the query parameters.

429.description: The service is busy. Too many requests in progress. Retry-After is set with the number of seconds before the request should be retried again.

503.description: The service is busy. Too many requests in progress. Retry-After is set with the number of seconds before the request should be retried again.

get.summary: Get detailed information about the quality of an observation.
get.description: This provides detailed information about an observation's parameter's quality.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: The quality flag combination you want information about. Normally, you should get this from an observations call.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to access

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: ISO language/locale of return values.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

get.summary: Get information about the existing quality flags.
get.description: This provides a list of all possible detail values given in the quality service.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: ISO language/locale of return values.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to access

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The output format of the result.

400.description: Invalid parameter value or malformed request.

404.description: No data was found for the list of query Ids.

previousLink.description: The previous link indicates how more data can be retrieved. It points to the URI to load the previous set of data.

@type.description: The type of the geometry object

sourceId.description: The Frost API id of the source.

version.description: The version of the source (if applicable).

geometry.description: Horizontal position (in longitude and latitude degrees) of the IDF location.

masl.description: Elevation (in meters above sea level) of the IDF location.

numberOfSeasons.description: The number of seasons the source has been operational.

firstYearOfPeriod.description: The first year of the data period.

lastYearOfPeriod.description: The last year of the data period.

unit.description: The unit of measure for the intensity. The default unit is litre/second*Hectar.

values.description: The values of the source and location.

id.description: The Frost API id of the element.

unit.description: The default unit, as used for data (UDUNITS notation). *code* if the unit is described using a code table.

codeTable.description: If the unit is a *code*, the codetable that describes the codes used.

timeOffsets.description: The time offsets of the element.

sensorLevels.description: The sensor levels of the element.

country.description: The country affiliation of the source.

levelType.description: The reference type of the level value.

unit.description: The unit of measurement of the level value.

sourceId.description: The sourceId at which this series of values were observed.

geometry.description: Spatial location of the data when it was observed (if known).

validFrom.description: The datetime from which data exists in this time series.

validTo.description: The datetime to which data exists in this time series. Null if data is still being added to the time series.

timeOffset.description: The offset from the validFrom datetime. Add the offset to validFrom to get the reference time of the first observation in the time series.

timeResolution.description: The time between consecutive observations in the time series. Given the reference time of an observation, add the timeResolution to get the next observation in the time series.

timeSeriesId.description: The internal ID of the time series.

elementId.description: The Frost API ID of the element observed.

unit.description: The unit of measure of the observed data. *code* if the unit is described using a code table.

codeTable.description: If the unit is a *code*, the codetable that describes the codes used.

status.description: The status of the time series.

uri.description: The URI that can be used to retrieve this time series.

ObservationTimeSeriesResponse.description: Data response for observation time series.

elementId.description: The ID of the element being observed.

value.description: The observed value (either a number or a UTC datetime of the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss).

origValue.description: The original observed value (either a number or a UTC datetime of the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.sss).

unit.description: The unit of measurement of the observed value.

codeTable.description: If the unit is a *code*, the codetable that describes the codes used.

level.description: The vertical level at which the value was observed (if known).

timeOffset.description: The offset from referenceTime at which the observation applies.

timeResolution.description: The time between consecutive observations in the time series to which the observation belongs.

timeSeriesId.description: The internal ID of the time series to which the observation belongs.

performanceCategory.description: The performance category of the source when the value was observed.

exposureCategory.description: The exposure category of the source when the value was observed.

qualityCode.description: The quality control flag of the observed value.

controlInfo.description: The control info of the observed value.

dataVersion.description: The data version of the data value, if one exists (**Note: Currently not available for any observation data).
